Package CarSharing.entities

Class Trip

  • java.lang.Object
    • CarSharing.entities.Trip
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Trip>
    public class Trip
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Trip>
    A trip in the car sharing system.
    A trip collects information about time, location, customer and car involved. It also contains a rate responsible for calculation of the total amount charged for a trip. Some operations' behavior depends on this trip's TripStatus.

      The state of this trip.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Trip​(Trip tr)
      Copies a trip.
      All attached objects, except the rate are duplicated.
      Trip​(Car car, Customer customer, Rate rate)
      Creates a Trip with specific car, customer and rate.
      Validates all arguments and throws an appropriate exception if any is invalid.
      Trip​(Car car, Customer renter, Rate rate, Location startLocation, DateTime startTime)
      Creates a Trip with specific car, customer and rate as well as start time and location.
      The created trip is in state 'started'.
      Trip​(Car car, Customer renter, Rate rate, Location startLocation, DateTime startTime, Location endLocation, DateTime endTime, double distance)
      Creates a Trip with specific car, customer and rate as well as start and end time and location and the distance traveled.
      The created trip is in state 'completed'.

        Creates a Trip with specific car, customer and rate as well as start and end time and location and the distance traveled.
        The created trip is in state 'completed'. Validates all arguments and throws an appropriate exception if any is invalid.
        Parameters:
        car - the cat of this trip
        renter - the customer of this trip
        rate - the rate of this trip
        startLocation - the location where this trip started
        startTime - the time when this trip started
        endLocation - the location where this trip ended
        endTime - the time when this trip ended
        distance - the distance traveled in km

        All attached objects, except the rate are duplicated.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public Trip start​(Location startLocation,
                  DateTime startTime)
        Starts this trip at a specific time and location.
        Sets start time and location (if the arguments are valid) and sets the state to 'started'. This operation is intended for method chaining. Validates all arguments and throws an appropriate exception if any is invalid.
        Also validates the state of this trip an IllegalSateException if this operation cannot be performed on this trip, i.e. neither completed nor started trips can be started.
        Parameters:
        startLocation - the location where this trip starts
        startTime - the time where this trip starts
        Returns:
        this trip

      • end

        public Trip end​(Location endLocation,
                DateTime endTime,
                double distance)
        Ends this trip at a specific time and location.
        Sets end time and location (if the arguments are valid) and sets the state to 'completed'. This operation is intended for method chaining. Validates all arguments and throws an appropriate exception if any is invalid.
        Also validates the state of this trip an IllegalSateException if this operation cannot be performed on this trip, i.e. only started trips can be completed.
        Parameters:
        endLocation - the location where this trip ends
        endTime - the time where this trip ends
        distance - the distance traveled
        Returns:
        this trip

      • total

        public final int total()
        Calculates the total amount charged for this trip.
        The calculation is delegated to the rate if this trip.

        the total amount charged for this trip

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Trip trip)
        Naturally, trips are ordered by start date.
        All trips that have not started are considered later than any trip that has started. That means a comparison with a trip that is created, but not started returns the highest int value. Otherwise the comparison is delegated to Comparable.compareTo(DateTime)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Trip>
        See Also:
        Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)

      • duration

        public int duration()
        The duration of this trip in seconds.
        Returns:
        the difference in seconds if this trip is completed, zero otherwise
        Hint:
